metadata.name: Japan Briefing
metadata.description: Daily news briefing for the NYT Tokyo Bureau Chief

all.headline: フィギュア男子シングル 鍵山優真 ショートプログラム2位 五輪
all.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック、フィギュアスケートは、10日、男子シングル前半のショートプログラムが行われ、日本のエース、鍵山優真選手が2位につけました。

all.headline: スキージャンプ混合団体 日本が銅メダル 五輪【詳しく】
all.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック、スキージャンプ混合団体で、日本が銅メダルを獲得しました。前回の北京大会から採用されたこの種目で、日本がメダルを獲得するのは初めてです。記事後半では日本の4人のメンバー、丸山希選手、小林陵侑選手、高梨沙羅選手、二階堂蓮選手のジャンプを時系列でお伝えしています。

all.headline: ミラノ・コルティナ五輪【結果】2／10～11タイムライン
all.description: 冬季オリンピック、ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック。日本時間の2月10日から11日の動きをお伝えしています。スキージャンプ混合団体で、日本が銅メダルを獲得しました。前回の北京大会から採用されたこの種目で、日本がメダルを獲得するのは初めてです。フィギュアスケートの男子シングルの演技が始まり、日本からは3人が前半のショートプログラムに臨みました。

all.headline: NY市場 一時1ドル＝154円台前半まで値上がり 消費減速懸念で
all.description: 10日のニューヨーク外国為替市場では、アメリカの個人消費が減速しているのではないかとの懸念からドルを売って円を買う動きが進み、円相場は一時、1ドル＝154円台前半まで値上がりしました。

all.headline: 米商務長官 エプスタイン氏との交友関係めぐる説明覆す
all.description: アメリカで性的虐待などの罪で起訴され、その後、死亡した富豪、エプスタイン氏との交友関係をめぐってラトニック商務長官は、2005年以降、関係を絶ったとするこれまでの説明を覆し、野党・民主党の議員などから辞任を求める声が出ています。

all.headline: 特別国会 自民が予算委員長などほとんどのポスト占める見通し
all.description: 衆議院選挙を受けた特別国会は来週18日に召集される予定です。与野党は衆議院の常任委員長などの配分を調整することにしていて、選挙で圧勝した自民党が予算委員長などほとんどのポストを占める見通しです。

all.headline: 国交省 外国人が公営住宅入居の際 国籍把握を全国自治体に通知
all.description: 政府が外国人政策をめぐる基本的な考え方をまとめたことを受けて、国土交通省は全国の自治体に対し、公営住宅に外国人が入居する際に、国籍を把握することなどを求める新たな指針を通知しました。

all.headline: After early end to Olympic campaign, where does Smile Japan go from here?
all.description: Coach Yuji Iizuka and his players say European teams have grown leaps and bounds since Beijing. How can Japan close the gap?

all.headline: Japan government debt rises to record ¥1.34 quadrillion in 2025
all.description: Of the total balance, general government bonds stood at ¥1.09 quadrillion, up ¥6.27 trillion.

all.headline: Japan Post ordered to halt 3,333 delivery vehicles
all.description: Japan Post has a total of some 32,000 delivery minivehicles at 3,188 post offices offering collection and delivery services across the country.

all.headline: Berlin's crumbling 'Russian houses' trapped in bureaucratic limbo
all.description: Known locally as the "Russian houses," they sheltered Soviet soldiers and their families in the eastern neighborhood of Karlshorst, the site of the Nazis' final capitulation.

all.headline: Russia aims only to ‘buy time’ in peace talks, spy report says
all.description: The assessment casts a shadow over U.S. President Donald Trump’s effort to end the four-year war, as his envoys seek to bring together Russian and Ukrainian negotiators.

all.headline: Blades of fury: Japan protests over 'rough' Olympic podium
all.description: A team official said the podium in Milan was "a rough, asphalt-like substance made of cut stone" that chipped skaters' blades when they stepped onto it for the medal ceremony.

all.headline: Prudential Life’s new CEO seeks to overhaul work culture in wake of fraud
all.description: The firm's compensation system, which is heavily weighted on performance, left employees on edge and played a major role in fueling the misconduct, the new CEO said.

all.headline: Yoshimura agrees to JIP presence in Takaichi Cabinet
all.description: It is not clear what position might be offered to the junior partner of the Liberal Democratic Party-led coalition.

all.headline: Nine Ehime Maru tragedy victims remembered 25 years on
all.description: About 260 people attended a memorial ceremony held at a high school in the city of Uwajima in Ehime Prefecture.

all.headline: Honda joins rivals in warning about costly slowdown in EV growth
all.description: Major automakers are warning of an electric vehicle winter as major markets roll back supportive policies, leaving the industry struggling to pivot to gas-electric hybrid models.

all.headline: Milano Cortina 2026: Japan Won Bronze in Mixed Team Ski Jumping
all.description: PREDAZZO, Italy, Feb 10 (Reuters) - Slovenia won the gold medal in the mixed team ski jumping event at the Milano Cortina Olympics on Tuesday, led by siblings Nika and Domen Prevc, while Norway claime

all.headline: Japan’s Ruling LDP Expresses Reservations about 2nd-Vote Passage of Bills; Hopes to Avoid Possible Antipathy from Overriding Will of Upper House
all.description: The Liberal Democratic Party has expressed reservations about using its newly gained ability to pass bills rejected in the House of Councillors by a second vote in the House of Representatives.

all.headline: Social Media Exerts Growing Influence on Elections; Online Videos Shape Issues by Spreading Often Unverified Information
all.description: In recent years, it has become common for people to consult social media for information when they decide whom to vote for. Since 2024, dubbed Japan’s “first year of social media elections,” these ser

all.headline: PM Takaichi’s Online Popularity Also Drives LDP to Landslide Victory in Japan’s Election, Followers on X Increased Rapidly During Campaign
all.description: A surge of social media interest in Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi may have fueled the Liberal Democratic Party’s historic landslide victory in Sunday’s House of Representatives election, potentially s

all.headline: 9 Ehime Maru Tragedy Victims Remembered 25 Years On
all.description: Uwajima, Ehime Pref., Feb. 10 (Jiji Press) — Bereaved relatives, students, teachers and others gathered Tuesday to mark 25 years since an incident in which a Japanese fisheries high school training ve

all.headline: Japan’s Liberal Democratic Party Cedes 14 Lower House Seats to Other Parties in Rare Instance Stemming From Landslide Win
all.description: Sunday’s House of Representatives election saw a rare occurrence — the Liberal Democratic Party had to give away 14 lower house seats to other parties because it did not have enough candidates to fill

all.headline: Milano Cortina 2026: Japanese Speed Skater Miho Takagi Wins Her First Milano Cortina Medal, Has Sights on Next Race
all.description: Japan’s Miho Takagi, who boasts the most Olympic medals of any female Japanese speed skater, has added another honor to her list of achievements. On Monday, Takagi claimed bronze in the women’s 1,000

all.headline: Milano Cortina 2026: Kokomo Murase Nabs Gold in Snowboard Big Air, Winning First-Ever Snowboarding Gold for Japanese Woman
all.description: MILAN — Kokomo Murase won the women’s snowboard big air on Monday, the fourth day of the Milano Cortina Winter Games, bringing Japan its first-ever Olympic gold in women’s snowboard events.

all.headline: Chewing Japan’s Schau Essen Sausages Produces Sounds that Resemble Those of Batting Home Run, Research Shows
all.description: The sound of biting into Schau Essen sausages resembles the sound of hitting a home run, according to the sausages’ manufacturer.

all.headline: Takaichi Seeks Plan for Consumption Tax Cut Before Summer; Says Willing to Take on Challenge of Constitutional Revision
all.description: Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi has announced her intention to promptly start discussions on reducing the consumption tax on food at a bipartisan national council and to present an interim plan before s

Japan has given Takaichi a landslide win - but can she bring back the economy?
all.description: Japan has been battling sluggish growth, mounting public debt and a rapidly ageing workforce.

all.headline: Thailand election: The result the polls never saw coming
all.description: Why did a youthful, progressive party do so poorly compared to a transactional, old-style party?

all.headline: Australian author's erotic novel is child sex abuse material, judge finds
all.description: The author's erotic novel featured an 18-year-old protagonist who role-played as a toddler.

all.headline: Philippine top court says same-sex couples can co-own property
all.description: The landmark decision said "legitimate intimate relationships" must not be "legally invisible".

all.headline: Twenty years is 'a death sentence', son of British media tycoon jailed by China says
all.description: A Hong Kong court sentences the 78-year-old British citizen Jimmy Lai to 20 years in prison after he was found guilty of national security offences last December.

all.headline: Are Bangladesh's youth turning against India?
all.description: Anti-Indianism is rising in Bangladesh as ties between the South Asian neighbours sink to a new low.

all.headline: Japanese stocks surge as Takaichi secures historic election victory
all.description: Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi's Liberal Democratic Party  secured 316 out of 465 seats in Sunday's election.

all.headline: Thai PM claims election victory with conservatives well ahead of rivals
all.description: The ruling conservatives defied opinion polls predicting a win for the reformist People's Party.

all.headline: Christchurch shooter seeks to overturn guilty plea
all.description: Brenton Tarrant is serving a life sentence after murdering 51 people in the March 2019 attack on two mosques in New Zealand.

all.headline: Hong Kong pro-democracy tycoon Jimmy Lai gets 20 years' jail
all.description: Lai's supporters say this amounts to a death sentence, but authorities say it demonstrates the rule of law.

all.headline: How Indonesia's new sex laws will affect tourists
all.description: International travelers have been flocking back to the popular resort island of Bali as the Covid pandemic subsides, prompting hopes that Indonesia's battered tourism industry is on the road to recove

all.headline: Afghanistan
North Korea
This 'edible' plastic bag alternative could save Nara's sacred deer
all.description: A local entrepreneur in the Japanese tourist destination of Nara has developed an alternative to plastic shopping bags, to protect the town's sacred deer.

all.headline: The battle to save Sri Lanka's leopards
all.description: Having endured a bloody civil war from 1983 until 2009, Sri Lanka is now at peace and developing rapidly. That's good news for the country as a whole, but the island nation's leopards are under threat

all.headline: Wildlife is flourishing around Fukushima
all.description: Nearly a decade after Japan's Fukushima nuclear disaster, researchers have discovered that wildlife is thriving in the areas evacuated by humans, despite radiological contamination.

all.headline: China debuts 620 kph train prototype
all.description: China has revealed a prototype for a new high-speed Maglev train that is capable of reaching speeds of 620 kilometers (385 miles) per hour.

all.headline: A Shanghai building 'walks' to a new location
all.description: Shanghai residents passing through the city's eastern Huangpu district in October might have stumbled upon an unusual sight: a "walking" building.

all.headline: Self-driving robotaxis are taking off in China
all.description: The world has been inching toward fully autonomous cars for years. In China, one company just got even closer to making it a reality.

all.headline: Travel to Japan during Covid-19: What you need to know
all.description: If you're planning a trip to Japan, here's what you'll need to know and expect if you want to visit during the global coronavirus pandemic.

competitors.description: Nearly a decade after Japan's Fukushima nuclear disaster, researchers have discovered that wildlife is thriving in the areas evacuated by humans, despite radiological contamination.

primary.headline: フィギュア男子シングル 鍵山優真 ショートプログラム2位 五輪
primary.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック、フィギュアスケートは、10日、男子シングル前半のショートプログラムが行われ、日本のエース、鍵山優真選手が2位につけました。

primary.headline: スキージャンプ混合団体 日本が銅メダル 五輪【詳しく】
primary.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック、スキージャンプ混合団体で、日本が銅メダルを獲得しました。前回の北京大会から採用されたこの種目で、日本がメダルを獲得するのは初めてです。記事後半では日本の4人のメンバー、丸山希選手、小林陵侑選手、高梨沙羅選手、二階堂蓮選手のジャンプを時系列でお伝えしています。

primary.headline: ミラノ・コルティナ五輪【結果】2／10～11タイムライン
primary.description: 冬季オリンピック、ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック。日本時間の2月10日から11日の動きをお伝えしています。スキージャンプ混合団体で、日本が銅メダルを獲得しました。前回の北京大会から採用されたこの種目で、日本がメダルを獲得するのは初めてです。フィギュアスケートの男子シングルの演技が始まり、日本からは3人が前半のショートプログラムに臨みました。

primary.headline: NY市場 一時1ドル＝154円台前半まで値上がり 消費減速懸念で
primary.description: 10日のニューヨーク外国為替市場では、アメリカの個人消費が減速しているのではないかとの懸念からドルを売って円を買う動きが進み、円相場は一時、1ドル＝154円台前半まで値上がりしました。

primary.headline: 米商務長官 エプスタイン氏との交友関係めぐる説明覆す
primary.description: アメリカで性的虐待などの罪で起訴され、その後、死亡した富豪、エプスタイン氏との交友関係をめぐってラトニック商務長官は、2005年以降、関係を絶ったとするこれまでの説明を覆し、野党・民主党の議員などから辞任を求める声が出ています。

primary.headline: 特別国会 自民が予算委員長などほとんどのポスト占める見通し
primary.description: 衆議院選挙を受けた特別国会は来週18日に召集される予定です。与野党は衆議院の常任委員長などの配分を調整することにしていて、選挙で圧勝した自民党が予算委員長などほとんどのポストを占める見通しです。

primary.headline: 国交省 外国人が公営住宅入居の際 国籍把握を全国自治体に通知
primary.description: 政府が外国人政策をめぐる基本的な考え方をまとめたことを受けて、国土交通省は全国の自治体に対し、公営住宅に外国人が入居する際に、国籍を把握することなどを求める新たな指針を通知しました。

primary.headline: After early end to Olympic campaign, where does Smile Japan go from here?
primary.description: Coach Yuji Iizuka and his players say European teams have grown leaps and bounds since Beijing. How can Japan close the gap?

primary.headline: Japan government debt rises to record ¥1.34 quadrillion in 2025
primary.description: Of the total balance, general government bonds stood at ¥1.09 quadrillion, up ¥6.27 trillion.

primary.headline: Japan Post ordered to halt 3,333 delivery vehicles
primary.description: Japan Post has a total of some 32,000 delivery minivehicles at 3,188 post offices offering collection and delivery services across the country.

primary.headline: Berlin's crumbling 'Russian houses' trapped in bureaucratic limbo
primary.description: Known locally as the "Russian houses," they sheltered Soviet soldiers and their families in the eastern neighborhood of Karlshorst, the site of the Nazis' final capitulation.

primary.headline: Russia aims only to ‘buy time’ in peace talks, spy report says
primary.description: The assessment casts a shadow over U.S. President Donald Trump’s effort to end the four-year war, as his envoys seek to bring together Russian and Ukrainian negotiators.

primary.headline: Blades of fury: Japan protests over 'rough' Olympic podium
primary.description: A team official said the podium in Milan was "a rough, asphalt-like substance made of cut stone" that chipped skaters' blades when they stepped onto it for the medal ceremony.

primary.headline: Prudential Life’s new CEO seeks to overhaul work culture in wake of fraud
primary.description: The firm's compensation system, which is heavily weighted on performance, left employees on edge and played a major role in fueling the misconduct, the new CEO said.

primary.headline: Yoshimura agrees to JIP presence in Takaichi Cabinet
primary.description: It is not clear what position might be offered to the junior partner of the Liberal Democratic Party-led coalition.

primary.headline: Nine Ehime Maru tragedy victims remembered 25 years on
primary.description: About 260 people attended a memorial ceremony held at a high school in the city of Uwajima in Ehime Prefecture.

primary.headline: Honda joins rivals in warning about costly slowdown in EV growth
primary.description: Major automakers are warning of an electric vehicle winter as major markets roll back supportive policies, leaving the industry struggling to pivot to gas-electric hybrid models.

primary.headline: Japan’s Ruling LDP Expresses Reservations about 2nd-Vote Passage of Bills; Hopes to Avoid Possible Antipathy from Overriding Will of Upper House
primary.description: The Liberal Democratic Party has expressed reservations about using its newly gained ability to pass bills rejected in the House of Councillors by a second vote in the House of Representatives.

primary.headline: Social Media Exerts Growing Influence on Elections; Online Videos Shape Issues by Spreading Often Unverified Information

primary.headline: Japan’s Liberal Democratic Party Cedes 14 Lower House Seats to Other Parties in Rare Instance Stemming From Landslide Win
primary.description: Sunday’s House of Representatives election saw a rare occurrence — the Liberal Democratic Party had to give away 14 lower house seats to other parties because it did not have enough candidates to fill

primary.headline: Milano Cortina 2026: Japanese Speed Skater Miho Takagi Wins Her First Milano Cortina Medal, Has Sights on Next Race
primary.description: Japan’s Miho Takagi, who boasts the most Olympic medals of any female Japanese speed skater, has added another honor to her list of achievements. On Monday, Takagi claimed bronze in the women’s 1,000

primary.headline: Milano Cortina 2026: Kokomo Murase Nabs Gold in Snowboard Big Air, Winning First-Ever Snowboarding Gold for Japanese Woman
primary.description: MILAN — Kokomo Murase won the women’s snowboard big air on Monday, the fourth day of the Milano Cortina Winter Games, bringing Japan its first-ever Olympic gold in women’s snowboard events.

primary.headline: Chewing Japan’s Schau Essen Sausages Produces Sounds that Resemble Those of Batting Home Run, Research Shows
primary.description: The sound of biting into Schau Essen sausages resembles the sound of hitting a home run, according to the sausages’ manufacturer.

tweets:
president of uae
@MohamedBinZayed
 I would like to express my sincere gratitude for the warm message of congratulations from His Highness.
Japan and the UAE have a long-standing friendship.
We will continue to work closely with His Highness to vigorously promote bilateral cooperation in a wide range of fields under the comprehensive and strategic partnership between our two countries.

أتقدم
In response to the results of Japan's general election, Mr. Sanae Takaichi, Prime Minister of Japan,
Congratulations to Shinkan Murase, the women's big air snowboarder at the Milan-Cortina Olympics, who became the first Japanese women's snowboarder to win a gold medal!

Prime Minister Stocker, I would like to thank you from the bottom of my heart for your warm words of congratulations.
I look forward to working with Chancellor Stocker as we work even more closely together to maintain and strengthen a free and open international order based on the rule of law.

Prime Minister
@_CStocker
, I sincerely appreciate your kind words of

I wholeheartedly congratulate Prime Minister @takaichi_sanae on her landslide victory in today’s parliamentary elections. In times of global uncertainty, a stable and like-minded partner such as Japan is particularly important to Austria and the European Union. (cs)
